meanings.definition: counterguerrillas: members of a military or paramilitary force trained to combat guerrilla warfare
meanings.sent1: The counterguerrillas were highly skilled in fighting against guerrilla tactics.
meanings.sent2: The counterguerrillas were deployed to eliminate the guerrilla threat in the region.
meanings.sent3: The counterguerrillas organized a surprise party to catch the guerrillas off guard.
meanings.sent4: In the chess game of warfare, the counterguerrillas moved to checkmate the guerrillas.
meanings.sent5: The counterguerrillas wore camouflage to blend in with the environment during their mission.

meanings.definition: counterguerrillas: actions or strategies used to combat guerrilla warfare
meanings.sent1: Effective counterguerrillas involve swift and decisive responses to guerrilla attacks.
meanings.sent2: The counterguerrillas implemented a new strategy to weaken the guerrilla forces.
meanings.sent3: The counterguerrillas decided to fight fire with fire by using guerrilla tactics themselves.
meanings.sent4: The counterguerrillas' plan was like a well-aimed arrow hitting the heart of the guerrilla operations.
meanings.sent5: The counterguerrillas' determination was a beacon of hope in the darkness of guerrilla warfare.

meanings.definition: counterguerrillas: relating to or characteristic of counterguerrilla warfare
meanings.sent1: The counterguerrillas training camp focused on teaching specialized tactics.
meanings.sent2: The counterguerrillas equipment was designed for stealth and precision.
meanings.sent3: The counterguerrillas' uniforms were a fashion statement in the military world.
